intro: Ostodes appendiculata, commonly known as the appendiculate ostodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences and are adapted for pollination by insects. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
